Node.definition: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
= state in which a countable entity is four in number
= part where converging sides or edges of an object meet; ≈ sometimes associated with the far side of an object

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to do something that may have a negative effect on someone or something else; ◄ usually caused by an emotion of affection or compassion

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
literally: to wake up, but extended to events: = process by which an event starts happening
exact meaning unsure, possibly: = the period of time taken for a series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which humans are shaken out of a state of complacency and routine, ◄ as a result of a certain event
= action by which humans utter loud expressions of joy
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: to pout our (one's) anger; hence: = action by which deities give full vent to their anger by punishing the offender
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= causative action by which deities, humans, or animals bring an activity to full completion
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to do something that may have a negative effect on someone or something else; ◄ usually caused by an emotion of affection or compassion

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
exact meaning unsure, possibly: = the period of time taken for a series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order
= process by which a plant produces flowers in the spring as a precursor to the plant's fruit; ≈ associated with strength, prosperity, and splendor
literally: stick; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a stick

= state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, foolishness, aggression, and rebellion against God
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
literally: stick; hence: = process of causing systematic suffering to someone else ◄ as if one were beating someone else with a stick
= state in which objects are abundant in quantity
= state in which humans possess a large quantity of goods
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
literally: to reach; hence: = process by which a certain event reaches the time for it to take place

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money
= to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances
= process by which deities experience extreme displeasure, ◄ described as an internal fire
= a large group of people
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which someone is alive and well
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= a large group of people
literally: to return (without having reached its goal); = process by which an event fails to reach its intended goal
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= always occurs parallel to נֶפֶשׁ ; literally: (someone's) life, though used in such a way that that life represents the entire person who owns it

Node.gloss: to hold on to|to devote oneself to|to persist in|to retain|to obtain
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities are actively involved in a certain event
= action by which humans blow air into a wind instrument and so produce a signal
exact meaning unsure: = wind instrument

Node.gloss: to prepare|to make ready|to make provisions (for something)
Node.definition: = causative action where humans or deities make objects ready for use

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= process by which deities experience extreme displeasure, ◄ described as an internal fire
= a large group of people
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= referent to the location outside of an object
in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)
= relation linking a proposition to a location: the part of an object that is visible from the perspective of someone located within that object
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)
in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

= a bird with a blue gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering
= a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
literally: (one's) hands are weak; hence: = state in which humans lack the confidence to perform a certain event
= central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength
literally: (one's) knees turn to water; hence: = to lose (one's) courage

Node.gloss: to gird oneself|to put on (clothes, armor)
Node.definition: = action by which someone ties a belt or piece of cloth around the waist; hence also: to put on clothes or armor
= a coarse dark material ◄ made of goat or camel hair; ► worn next to the skin as a sign of mourning or repentance
literally: to cover; hence: = process by which certain events happen with a great intensity and are often more than the recipient can bear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= state in which objects are considered impure because of their association with evil practices
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= causative process by which humans or deities cause the desire of (other) humans to be fulfilled

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
literally: stumbling block; hence: = a condition that causes humans not to live up to the expectations others have of them
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= state in which something is beautiful and attractive to look at
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing in the form of an image or a drawing; ► functioning in non sanctioned rituals or as an object of non sanctioned worship

= a reference to the physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship, ≈ with a very strong added connotation of something utterly detestable

= a reference to the physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship, ≈ with a very strong added connotation of something utterly detestable
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= state in which objects are considered impure because of their association with evil practices
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
= all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= causative action by which humans (or deities by human hands) cause land, buildings, or other objects to be unfit for religious use ◄ usually by unlawful behavior

Node.gloss: to turn (one's) face|to look away|to leave (someone) alone
Node.definition: literally: to turn (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities refrain from engaging in an activity involving another party
= causative action by which humans (or deities by human hands) cause land, buildings, or other objects to be unfit for religious use ◄ usually by unlawful behavior

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: stored up in a safe place, hence: = person or object considered valuable and/or treated with affection
= causative action by which humans (or deities by human hands) cause land, buildings, or other objects to be unfit for religious use ◄ usually by unlawful behavior
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= a series of metal links or rings fitted into one another and used to joining different objects together; also used for decoration purposes

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= state in which a person, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= causative action by which humans (or deities by human hands) cause land, buildings, or other objects to be unfit for religious use ◄ usually by unlawful behavior
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
= causative process by which an event inspires terror in humans
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

Node.gloss: to be clothed (with a certain state)
Node.definition: literally: to be clothed; hence: = process by which humans or deities attain a certain quality or status

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to be in anguish|to be dismayed
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such trembling and pain
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the outcome of a dispute between two or more parties, decided by a judge or a deity
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
